alert.note: Alert for Gila (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 23 at 2:45PM MST until September 23 at 5:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Slate Creek basin in... Gila County in east central Arizona... * Until 545 PM MST. * At 244 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Slate Creek basin. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Slate Creek basin. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Slate Creek basin. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Gila County This includes the following highways... State Route 188 between mile markers 267 and 269. State Route 87 near mile marker 230. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Get to higher ground immediately! Raging flash flood waters and debris will inundate residences near State Route 188 along the banks of Slate Creek. Turn Around, Don`t Drown! National Forest Service Road 26 and low water crossings through Slate Creek will be washed out and impassable. Flood waters may overtop State Route 188 as culverts become clogged from flood debris.
